I'm seeing an ugly hue of green with a bit of purple... :| EDIT: I don't think so. It's very difficult to pick a color with the wheel. I think I'll have better luck with precise value input.
Which color works well is highly dependent on the device. This is why I allow picking of a color. Could you not find a color that works well for you?
One gripe: dark ui theme unuseable because of white text on bright green header - unreadable.

Ora provo con rTorrent

Money? This is an open source app, build in my free time. As far as I know you can still use Transmission with QNAP devices. The standard torrent client does not have an official API I can use (and I have to test NAS to try to work around this limitation).

title: Only WebUI support for Deluge
comment: Deluge has a client/server mode, but this app doesn't support it. I'm not going to install and run the webui just for this.

Actually it connects to the JSON RPC API that Deluge exposes (indeed via the same function as the web UI). Is this not working for you? I will add client protocol version support in the future, but I am not sure it will be very reliable as mobile devices constantly drop connections.

title: Fantastic but have one small issue
comment: This app is easily the best torrent manager out there but I do have one little annoying issue. I let the app decide which server address to use based on my home SSID. However I have both a 2,5 and a 5GHZ signal. Each with their own SSID. I want to be able to set them both in the SSID 'whitelist' (be it comma or backslash separated). Now when I am on my 5GHZ band I can't access my server and vice versa. I have to manually switch either my WiFi connection or app settings. Other than that this app is perfect!

title: Good as advertised
comment: It's a useful multi torrent remote. Important functions like adding, deleting, stopping, and monitoring downloads makes this android app a must have for torrent-crazy users out there. I love the interface and notifications that specifically lets you know if a download has completed. Torrents / magnet links can also be directly associated with this app eliminating the need for a bothersome copy and paste routine.

title: Brilliant, after tedious setup process
comment: After you figure out how to set up this sucker with your seedbox, this thing is king. Manages my seedbox like a pro. Only thing is that it doesn't play nice with private trackers. It auto takes over .torrent file downloads for private trackers but cannot add the torrent properly. Instead, I have to long-hold .torrent file downloads and manually save it locally - then open it in this app.

comment: Transdroid is way better, having res feed integrated

title: Works great
comment: Beautiful UI and responsive too!

title: Setup was easy
comment: This app works great. Now if only I could figure out deluge and why it's crashing

title: Very nice
comment: Using this with tTorrent. Works like a champ. Would be nice to see which directory the torrent is going to.

title: Quite good
comment: and nice. I'm using it as a Deluge client over https. Connects without a problem. Crashed few times when I was checking torrent details. Adding torrent from Firefox doesn't work. Browser asks me with which client to open file and I select Transdrone. Program is then opened, but no torrent is actually added. Changing the torrent label also doesn't work. Please fix these bugs and I'll give 5 stars.  As promissed. Giving you 5 stars! You are doing awesome job!

title: Good app but lacks queue management
comment: A very good app, but lacks a crucial feature which is queue management.
Isn't ttorent just need transcribe/transdroid

title: Great Start... needs Queue Management
comment: The app works quite well. Easy to setup, clean simple UI, and lots of support for various clients.... However for Deluge (and probably the others) there isn't a way to sort by queue order or even move torrents within the queue.  I desperately need this feature; my household has a shared Linux seedbox and I want to queue my files to finish first.

title: Lovely
comment: I really enjoy using this app, it's clean, quick and does its job so well. I avoided other apps because I didn't like the look and feel of them but this one looks amazing and is very intuitive to use. Thanks!

title: Works great
comment: I'm using it to control rtottent. It would be nice if you could set download and upload limits separately.

title: No tixati support:(
comment: 5 star when supporting tixati

title: Magnet
comment: Doesn't seem to import torrents when using magnet links even though it says it added? Using ruTorrnent

title: Excellent
comment: So much better the BT remote. Ftp could use some work but excellent job overall, just what I was looking for

title: Compatible with Raspbmc
comment: Excellently support Deluge on Raspberry pi (raspbmc). It's even better than its built-in web ui as this recognises magnet URLs! Thank you so much.
Ok

title: Very good
comment: Quickest way to watch my server.  Really like the option for dark UI  (please don't break this ; it works really good right now)
Great app, thank you for this

title: Awesome
comment: Great app. I can manage all my torrents off my seedbox like a boss :p

title: Great but
comment: If you use rutorrent, Google for "rutorrent and transdroid" and look for results on the rutorrent website. App is great but I don't like being forced to use a particular file manager for adding a torrent. That's my only complaint!
Hmm

title: Way beyond expectations
comment: First app ever that I'd give 10 stars to. Beautiful, simple, functional, fast.

title: Looks sweet
comment: Awesome app

title: Awesome
comment: Thanks for adding auto-refresh..

You can set the maximum transfer limits by tapping the status view in the top action bar. If you want to filter teh visible list of torretns with only those that are transferring data, use the 'Treat 0KB/s torrent as dormant' option, available in the system settings.

title: Unstable and needs polish
comment: The app crashes frequently for me on all of my devices. It's also hard to read/understand the ui. For example completed torrents look the same as paused torrents.

title: Works great
comment: Fast easy to use interface.

title: Perfect
comment: An application that I was exactly looking for. Thanks

title: Feel the love! (Transdrone/Transdroid)
comment: If you have a remote torrent server then this is the app you have been looking for.  However read the description and sideload the Transdroid app (big brother of Transdrone) from the repository to get the full RSS leaching power of your server. If you reside in a country with strict torrent censorship (looking at you, UK) install Orbot, have it autostart, set an exit node in a country that's torrent friendly, and configure Orbot to manage all Transdroid Search module traffic. Search will now work.

title: Fantastic design and functionality
comment: Working great!

title: Best app ever for seedbox
comment: I can't believe I finally found an app that has more functionality than just view and add. Thank u so much... Great app!

title: Excellent
comment: After setting up a deluge torrent-box I was needing access to remotely add magnets via my phone. This app accomplishes this, as well as adding various other options.  10/10 - Does what I needed plus extra.

title: Works great
comment: There is a little overlay with some of the writing (letters overlap each other)  But still totally usable. Thanks
Great app

title: It is a good start
comment: I like the new look and feel. I still prefer the widget of the old Transdroid so I keep both around. Big thanks to the Devs.
This feature was added in Transdroid/Transdrone 2.1.0 (see the 'Treat dormant torrents as inactive' option). Hope you'll like it. :)

title: Doesn't work properly with bitcomet
comment: And please add flashget support if possible.

title: Painless and slick
comment: This rules. Easy configuration. Worked straight away. Slick interface. I'd pay for this app.

title: Good
comment: Best well rounded torrenting remote I could find.

title: Works
comment: Pretty good, but always crashes
Nice App

title: App works great
comment: Been using transdroid for sometime, glad to see a version of it back on the google market! Dev often updates/adds features to the app, works fast. I wish there was a way to monitor my server's rss feeds and modify per torrent override settings.

title: Great app
comment: If i could connect to my deluge server with remote connect(like in deluge desktop apps) not via web ui that would be perfect. Idk if its even possible. If i get a reply i will give 5* 😀
Phony!
Phony? In what way?

title: Great client
comment: It would be very useful to control (start/stop) individual files from a torrent.

title: Awsome :)
comment: Love this app! Perfect layout and never had any problems!

title: Nice
comment: Great app. Nice UI. But i have run into a problem. I am using qbittorrent in windows and I can't set the download and upload limits. Please fix.

title: What more do you want?
comment: Does what it says it does.
Extremely Useful

title: Awesome ui, almost perfect
comment: But it'd be nice to change the standard settings on transmission (particularly for me, the destination for downloads) globally, rather than just change individual files parameters.

title: Frustrating
comment: Haven't ever been able to connect, no matter what settings I use. A simple guide would be bloody helpful, even Google searches reveal nothing about the android app, it's all PC based info.
See my website for install guides: www.transdroid.org What client do you want to connect to?

title: Love the new version
comment: Developer is always right there, if i experience any issues.  Thank You!

title: Works well with Deluge and rTorrent
comment: Generally works well with both and , except in Deluge (Windows), when creating new labels, 1. It doesn't get created, nor does it get assigned to the torrent. 2 When creating new labels in above, causes the app to constantly say "error with connection".  Other than the minor problems with the labels, the app works extremely well with both clients, one of the best I've seen.

title: Great app
comment: Works perfectly but wish the white flash on launch when using the dark theme could be fixed. Apparently other devs have resolved it by removing the launch animation.
I can think of 1 hacky solution, but I'll have to investigate. thanks for your rating.

title: Rss
comment: Where did it go?! :(
RSS (and search) is only in the full version, called Transdroid, as available on my website. Sorry, I don't want Google to kick the app from the Play Store again.

title: Boom last update did the trick
comment: Latest update fixed the issue and it work perfectly now thanks
Please try the 2.1.1 update; this fixes rTorrent connectivity with Digest authentication. If that doesn't work, please use the Error report feature from the System settings.

title: Re: Labels
comment: Update: I whinged, dev fixed. No complaints anymore. Cheers!
You can find the labels in the filter drow down (where the serves and status filters are as well). What client do you use?

title: Move over TorrentToise
comment: I have been looking for an all in one torrent remote for my uTorrent Server at home and TT was my preference but labels are a big thing for me - not only does this let me pick from my preassigned labels (unlike TorrentToise which was manual) it does it whilst looking so perfectly Android (Holo is important to me) - really guys, the UI is impeccable as well as the app - thanks!

title: Nice
comment: Simple, handy, nice ui

title: Best torrent manager I've used
comment: Works like a charm had no issues

title: Good
comment: Like this app alot, can interact with the desktop uTorrent client in ways no other remote torrent app can.  The  only problems, 1 when adding a new torrent from Kat, app gives a server error, but if I hit back and then reclick link it works.  This  also happens when downloading the torrent link and adding it manually.  2, get a transdrone not responding after several hours even though the app is not running.

title: Love the new app
comment: Glad to see you back on the Play Store

title: Nice!
comment: Pretty and functional

title: Welcome back
comment: I love you transdroid

title: Not usable with Deluge
comment: There's a major drawback for Deluge user. App requires Deluge Web UI to be installed and connected to daemon which is really bad idea. Instead of this app should rely on daemon only.  Also with Deluge notifications do not work when torrent download finishes on server.  Giving two stars and hoping author will redesign the way how the app talks to deluge instance.

Why is this a rally bad idea? The Deluge web rpc-api is specifically designed for this purpose and I can use normal HTTP calls as with any other supported client. (Also, you can let your daemon auto-connect if you don't use multiple daemons.)

title: Too good
comment: Initially difficult..  but easy once you get to know it well

title: very disappointment
comment: useless app. never recommend to any one.. official remote control app is better than this.  wasted my one hour to for setup. still connection problem. we are not technician or programmer who can easily do it.  setup guide is for old version cant able to any thing. tried with both utorrent and bittorrent

title: Why OI FILE Manager?
comment: I already have a file manager, why do I need to get Oi FILE Manager?

I prefer not to duplicate functionality and let a third party app do the file picking. Unfortunately IO File Manager seems the only one who supports this. Perhaps I will implement a file picker myself.

title: Welcome back!
comment: I have a setting for LAN and one for WAN. Widgets were really useful to get direct access! And could you support multiple file selector? I think there's something built in Android to let choose a file picker. Thanks a lot and good work!

title: Can't Connect?
comment: Configured same way I used it before and no way is it connecting back to my Transmission torrent server running on my Synology.   Fixed my problem by adding SSID and specifying internal IP. I never connect externally so this makes it a pain.
So you can connect fine? You don't HAVE to use the local network (via SSID) option; just use your local IP in the normal address field in that case.

title: So many missing features in new version...
comment: A lot of functionality is missing from older versions. All the features I used to use this app for are gone. From the widget, I want to see an overview of all my torrents, how many up/down, total speed, etc. The new widget no longer shows this, it is a scrollable list of all my running torrents without any useful overview info. Why would I want to see that on the widget? I'd open the app for that. Also, I want to have global pause and resume from the widget, but that's been cut out as well. Why?
Because I got from my users that they wanted a widget that lists all torrents, so I build it. I will add another widget with general statistics in a future release.

title: Good to see it at the place where it belongs
comment: Just a suggestion, please show the progress bar even when the torrent is paused.

title: Great app
comment: It worked as I expected. Great work, and being open-source is awesome!

title: Errors
comment: Lots of connection errors since update. Rolling back until fixed.

title: Great product, widget broken with update
comment: Trying to add a widget to the home screen results in the program closing. Also, can you bring back different sized widgets? The 2x1 one was all I needed, and saved more space than the 3x2 widget. Same issue on Transdroid v2. Can I download a Transdroid version older than v2 somewhere to get my widget back?   Other than this one issue, great program. Love it!

title: Looking Good :Except Torrents finishing don't notify as configured -)
comment: Background notifications not working on Nexus 4. It initially died on WIFi connection and  wouldn't restart (sent Android "Reports") until I cleared the apps data.   Can't  update transfer speeds ("please enter a positive number"). Has bad  options style  as it doesn't display the "current" options, you have to go in to "change" to see what most are. Still can't set a default filter to "Active" torrents etc!!!!  Text in top bar chopped of at bottom om Nexus 4, Text in torrent details also overwrites. The vertical "..." should not have a single menu option of settings but should take you straight to settings (or get ride of it and add a button). If notifications ticked, no way to turn LED Color Off for people using "Light Flow" etc.  Notification check interval should be a per connection property (quick on WIFI, slower on 3G, also better if I could choose my own value).   FYI: Zone Alarm was causing me issues over a 3G connection. Refreshes still occasionally hang until settings opened/closed.

title: Finally, back in the market and with a new UI!
comment: Been using the Alpha version of Transdroid for a while now (it looks and works so much nicer than the prior version), and am excited to see Transdrone back on the market (so I get the auto-updating features of Google Play, rather than having to update the apk manually).  Nice program that lets me monitor my Torrents from the couch. Thanks for writing it!

title: Pause all torrents?
comment: How do you pause all torrents after the update?
Long press a torrent to get into contextual mode. Use the top selection drop down to select all torrents and then perform an action.

title: Great app, hate when features are removed
comment: This trend of Android devs removing features in new versions just for the sake of Holo is really starting to agitate me. Missing features: swipe (or other way) to change server without menu access; OS "Shortcut" presence for direct access to server profile; "Delete" from the long press menu; white loading screen so I'm blinded at night with a pure white screen before the theme loads. And insult to injury? If I use the old version it constantly prompts me to update it.

Sorry to hear. Admittedly some features are still missing, but most will soon be added (like swiping and server shortcuts). The 'blinding' white screen (before the black theme is loaded) is an Android limitation it seems; I'll do my best to solve it. You can always disable app update notifications from the settings!

title: Awesome!
comment: Best remote torrent manager by far. Glad to see it back in the play store, hopefully here to stay :)

title: Welcome back!!
comment: I've been using this app since the early Transdroid versions. Its a must have to manage your remote torrent server.

title: Great to see it back
comment: long time user, loving the news interface. will probably keep using transdroid from the website but glad it is back in the play store

title: Deluge
comment: It is working connected with Deluge on Ubuntu Linux.
Sorry to hear that. Could you send an error report (from the system settings) so I can help you with the setup?

title: Love Transdrone (or Transdroid)
comment: Had been using Transdroid for years. Best torrent client on Android.  The v2 alpha/beta was great and glad it was officially released.  Also, it works great for me on Deluge.

title: Very good.
comment: Interface is excellent. Works "as advertised". Can't think of anything else to say. Get it now!
